description.narrative: The Australia Indonesia Partnership for Decentralisation (AIPD) will provide technical assistance and capacity building support to local governments and civil society to better manage public resources, leading to a better operating environment that targets improved service delivery outcomes and reduced poverty. On the 'supply side' the program will work to help build capacity for improved budget planning and execution in provincial and district governments. On the 'demand side' the AIPD will facilitate improved transparency and accountability and strengthen civil society engagement in budget planning and monitoring. AIPD will help improve knowledge sharing and information exchange between supply and demand side stakeholders by facilitating dialogue and evidence-based decision making processes. The total value of this program is $70.0 million over 5 years, starting 2010-11.
